meanings.definition: Avoiding something by moving quickly out of the way.
meanings.sent1: She was dodging the flying ball in the game.
meanings.sent2: The cat was dodging the raindrops by hiding under the porch.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was dodging the acorns falling from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The dancer was dodging through the crowd like a leaf in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The child learned the art of dodging obstacles on the playground.

meanings.definition: Evading or escaping from something, especially by deceit or trickery.
meanings.sent1: The thief was dodging the security cameras in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The fox was dodging the hunters by running through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The student was dodging the teacher's questions during the quiz.
meanings.sent4: The politician was dodging the tough questions during the interview.
meanings.sent5: The spy was dodging the enemy agents in the dark alley.
